p: The mice-adapted pandemic virus H1N1 used in the study was passed serially 20 times in a mouse lungs and differed from the parent A/Hamburg/2009 (H1N1) strain by a deletion in neuraminidase (NA) and mutations in the HA, NP, PA, and PB1 proteins ( Table). The H1N1 influenza virus is 105â€“fold more pathogenic for mice compared to the initial parent strain.
